meanings.definition: Wind (a clock or other device) with too much tension.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally overwound the clock, and now it won't tick properly.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to overwind the toy car, or the spring may break.
meanings.sent3: Dad always overwinds the old clock, thinking it will make time go faster.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement overwinding her voice, she spoke too loudly in the library.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the room was palpable, like an overwinding spring ready to snap.

meanings.definition: Exceed the proper limit or degree.
meanings.sent1: I tend to overwind my worries, making them seem bigger than they are.
meanings.sent2: If you overwind your enthusiasm, people might find you too intense.
meanings.sent3: She always overwinds her stories, adding more drama than needed.
meanings.sent4: The argument escalated quickly, each side trying to overwind the other.
meanings.sent5: His laughter overwound the room, filling it with joy and warmth.
